item.title: Police officer in remand for allegedly accepting bribe - The Sun Daily
item.description:
Police officer in remand for allegedly accepting bribe  The Sun Daily

IPOH: A police officer is in remand for three days for alleged bribery, involving RM8,000. The remand order, from today until Dec 10, was issued by Ma...

item.description:
Temple fracas: One City employee's remand extended - Nation  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA (Bernama): The magistrate's court here has extended the remand order against a One City Development Sdn Bhd security guard for another ...

item.title: Remand against 10 temple rioters extended - The Sun Daily
item.description:
Remand against 10 temple rioters extended  The Sun Daily

PETALING JAYA: A magistrates court here issued a three-day remand order against two people arrested for damaging the MCT Tower during the riots on Tue...

item.title: Court throws out remand application against Sundra Rajoo - The Malaysian Insight
item.description:
Court throws out remand application against Sundra Rajoo  The Malaysian Insight

THE Putrajaya magistrates' court has rejected a remand application from the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) against Professor Dr Sundra ...

item.title: Remand for babysitter's husband extended again (NSTTV) - New Straits Times
item.description:
Remand for babysitter's husband extended again (NSTTV)  New Straits Times

KUALA LUMPUR: The remand order on a man who allegedly sexually and physically abused 11-month-old baby, Nur Muarzara Ulfa Muhammad Zainal or Zara, ...

item.description:
Remand for One City employees extended in temple riot case  The Malaysian Insight

THE remand orders against two One City Development Sdn Bhd (One City) employees have been extended for three days to facilitate investigation on the rioting ...

item.title: Boy Tiger and wife's remand orders extended (NSTTV) - New Straits Times
item.description:
Boy Tiger and wife's remand orders extended (NSTTV)  New Straits Times

KUALA LUMPUR: The remand on Khairul Izaini Khairuddin, better known as 'Boy Tiger', alleged to have abused his three-year-old stepson to death, has been ...

item.title: Remand for youth accused of drug possession - Fiji Times
item.description:
Remand for youth accused of drug possession  Fiji Times

A 25-YEAR-OLD man charged with one count of unlawful possession of illicit drugs has been remanded by the Suva Magistrates Court. It is alleged that Isimeli ...

item.title: Two get six-day police remand in Rs 1.33-crore fraud - Times of India
item.description:
Two get six-day police remand in Rs 1.33-crore fraud  Times of India

CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh district court has sent two persons from Madhya Pradesh to six days in police custody in a case related to fraudulent bank .

item.title: Four fake MACC officers remanded for soliciting RM2mil bribe [NSTTV] - New Straits Times
item.description:
Four fake MACC officers remanded for soliciting RM2mil bribe [NSTTV]  New Straits Times

PUTRAJAYA: Four men who posed as Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission officers (MACC) have been remanded six days for allegedly soliciting a RM2 ...

item.title: Robbery suspects remain in remand - Fiji Times
item.description:
Robbery suspects remain in remand  Fiji Times

THREE men charged with three counts of aggravated robbery have been further remanded by the High Court in Suva. Maika Tovagone, Asesela Naureure and ...

item.title: Court sends traders in 5-day police remand - Times of India
item.description:
Court sends traders in 5-day police remand  Times of India

SHIMLA: A day after two Kala Amb industrialists were arrested by a team of excise and taxation department, South enforcement zone, Parwanoo, in a GST .

item.title: Badboy Russian internationals to spend CHRISTMAS in jail as court extends remand until New Year - RT
item.description:
Badboy Russian internationals to spend CHRISTMAS in jail as court extends remand until New Year  RT

Zenit St. Petersburg striker Aleksandr Kokorin and Krasnodar midfielder Pavel Mamaev will spend Christmas in prison after being remanded in custody to await ...

item.title: Khatauli murder case: Second accused gets 5-day remand - Times of India
item.description:
Khatauli murder case: Second accused gets 5-day remand  Times of India

PANCHKULA: The second accused arrested in Khatauli murder case was on Sunday presented before a court, which sent him to five days police remand.

item.title: Four remanded over attack on fireman injured in Seafield temple fracas - The Star Online
item.description:
Four remanded over attack on fireman injured in Seafield temple fracas  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA (Bernama): The magistrate's court here issued a four-day remand order against four men involved in an attack on firefighter Muhammad Adib Mohd Kassim during a fracas at the Sri Maha Mariamman Temple in Subang Jaya last week. The order was issued by Magistrate Mohd Nor Hafidzuddin Yusoff on Friday to assist with police investigation under Section 307 of the Penal Code for attempted murder. Muhammad Adib was seriously injured in the incident and reported to be still in a critical but stable condition at the National Heart Institute. The riots which took place on Nov 26 and 27 f...

item.title: Another 21 people remanded over temple riots - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

The Magistrate's Court here today issued a remand order for between two and four days against another 21 individuals to assist in investigations related to the fracas at the Sri Maha Mariamman Temple in USJ 25, near Subang Jaya, last week. Magistrate Nurshahirah Abd Salim issued the remand order from today to allow investigations into all the suspects aged 18 to 40 years old. They were detained to assist in investigations under various sections of the Penal Code – Section 435 (mischief by fire), Section 148 (possession of weapons at riot), Section 427 (mischief), Section 447 (criminal tresp...

item.title: Huawei CFO accused of fraud by US authorities - Financial Times
item.description:
Huawei CFO accused of fraud by US authorities  Financial Times

US authorities are seeking the extradition of Huawei’s chief financial officer on an allegation of fraud, claiming that Meng Wanzhou lied to American banks about the relationship between the Chinese telecoms group and a company called Skycom in order to circumvent sanctions on Iran. The details of the US case against Ms Meng — the daughter of Ren Zhengfei, founder of Huawei — were laid out during a bail hearing on Friday in a court in Vancouver, where she was arrested last weekend while in transit from Hong Kong to Mexico. The hearing was held over until Monday after a day-long tussle betwe...

item.title: Suspect remanded over calf carcass and death threat sent to Salahuddin - The Star Online
item.description:
Suspect remanded over calf carcass and death threat sent to Salahuddin  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: A dead calf together with a death threat were sent to Agriculture and Agro-based Industry Minister Datuk Salahuddin Ayub, but he brushed it off as a prank. But police later told him that they were investigating the case. “When I arrived at the scene, my first reaction was that someone was just playing around and I hoped it would not be prolonged. “But yesterday (Wednesday), the police told me this was a serious case as a minister had been threatened. “I understand that the case is being investigated under Section 507 of the Penal Code,” Salahuddin told reporters at the Parliam...

item.title: Indian court remands British businessman accused in AgustaWestland 'copter deal - Reuters
item.description:
Indian court remands British businessman accused in AgustaWestland 'copter deal  Reuters

An Indian court on Wednesday remanded to custody a British businessman accused of paying bribes to Indian officials to win a helicopter deal for Anglo-Italian firm AgustaWestland, following a rare extradition. The case threatens strong repercussions for India's opposition Congress party, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ruling party called the extradition of Christian Michel a victory in its fight against graft. "Who knows what secrets will tumble out once he starts talking?" Modi said at a rally in western Rajasthan which is electing a new state assembly. Modi is seeking to embarrass Cong...

item.title: Syrian aid worker who swam refugees to safety freed from Greek jail - The Guardian
item.description:
Syrian aid worker who swam refugees to safety freed from Greek jail  The Guardian

After 107 days of incarceration, Sarah Mardini – the Syrian human rights worker who saved 18 refugees in 2015 by swimming their waterlogged dinghy to the shores of Lesbos with her Olympian sister – has been freed from Greece’s toughest jail. The 23-year-old was released late on Wednesday from the high-security Koryallos prison in Athens, where she was being held in pre-trial detention on charges of people-smuggling. She was allowed to walk free after her lawyers posted €5,000 (£4,450) in bail. Related: Arrest of Syrian 'hero swimmer' puts Lesbos refugees back in spotlight Sean Binder, a 24-...

item.title: Nissan panel puts off selection of nominee to succeed Ghosn: source - Reuters
item.description:
Nissan panel puts off selection of nominee to succeed Ghosn: source  Reuters

A Nissan Motor Co (7201.T: Quote, Profile, Research, Stock Buzz) panel on Tuesday failed to nominate a successor to Carlos Ghosn as chairman in the wake of his arrest and dismissal for alleged financial misconduct last month, a source familiar with the situation told Reuters. Ghosn could remain in detention until the end of the year as Tokyo prosecutors plan to rearrest him on a fresh claim of understating his income, the Sankei newspaper has reported. Nissan has tasked a three-member panel of external directors with the selection of a new chairman. The panel includes Masakazu Toyoda - a fo...

item.title: Amnesty International calls for Thailand to release Australian refugee footballer - ABC News
item.description:
Amnesty International calls for Thailand to release Australian refugee footballer  ABC News

Amnesty International Australia has called for the release of a Melbourne-based refugee and football player from a detention centre in Thailand, after he was detained at the request of Bahrain. Hakeem Ali AlAraibi — a Bahraini national — was detained at Bangkok Airport a week ago and remains in custody despite being cleared to return home after the Red Notice used to detain him was lifted. While Thai officials said on Monday he may be released on Tuesday, documents obtained by rights groups showed Mr AlAraibi would be remanded for 12 more days. Bahraini officials have formally requested tha...

item.title: Four Catalan leaders facing trial in Spain go on hunger strike - The Guardian
item.description:
Four Catalan leaders facing trial in Spain go on hunger strike  The Guardian

Four of the Catalan leaders facing trial over last year’s failed push for regional independence have gone on a hunger strike, claiming they are being treated unfairly by the Spanish justice system. On Saturday, JordiSànchez, the former head of the powerful grassroots group Catalan National Assembly, and Jordi Turull, a former Catalan government spokesman, announced they were embarking on the strike at Lledoners prison. The pair accuse Spain’s constitutional court of deliberately blocking their numerous appeals to prevent their cases progressing to the European court of human rights. “We ask...

item.title: Japanese prosecutors to arrest Ghosn on fresh claim, prolonging custody - The Star Online
item.description:
Japanese prosecutors to arrest Ghosn on fresh claim, prolonging custody  The Star Online

TOKYO: Tokyo prosecutors plan to arrest Carlos Ghosn on a fresh claim of understating his income, the Sankei newspaper reported on Tuesday, in a move that could keep the former chairman of Nissan Motor Co in detention until the end of the year. Ghosn has been detained in Tokyo since his Nov. 19 arrest on suspicion of conspiring with former Nissan Representative Director Greg Kelly to understate his compensation by about half of the actual 10 billion yen ($88 million), over five years from 2010. Tokyo authorities on Friday extended their detention until the maximum Dec. 10 for the alleged cr...

item.title: Erdogan extends crackdown despite plaudits over Khashoggi response - Financial Times
item.description:
Erdogan extends crackdown despite plaudits over Khashoggi response  Financial Times

When police boarded Osman Kavala’s flight and summoned him to the front of the plane, he assumed that he had dropped his ID card. But the Turkish businessman and philanthropist was taken to a police station, then to jail. More than one year on, he remains behind bars, waiting for an indictment that details the allegations against him. “It seems quite unbelievable that he has been deprived of his freedom for so long,” said his wife, Ayse Bugra Kavala. Recep Tayyip Erdogan, the Turkish president, has won international plaudits for his dogged pursuit of the case of Jamal Khashoggi — the Saudi ...

item.title: US Marshal killed outside Tucson house, suspect detained - The Associated Press
item.description:
US Marshal killed outside Tucson house, suspect detained  The Associated Press

PHOENIX (AP) — A deputy U.S. marshal serving a fugitive arrest warrant against a man accused of stalking a female police sergeant after she seized a handgun and ammunition from him last year has been shot and killed outside a Tucson house. The suspect had recently visited Tucson Police Department, where he confronted the sergeant in person, then filed an online complaint about last year's seizure of his weapon, demanding that she and other officers be "arrested" and warning against the possibility of a "shootout at the OK Corral," authorities said. Chase White, 41, was shot while serving th...

item.title: Japan court OKs extending custody of ex-Nissan chairman - The Associated Press
item.description:
Japan court OKs extending custody of ex-Nissan chairman  The Associated Press

TOKYO (AP) — A Japanese court on Friday approved a 10-day extension of the detention of former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn. The Tokyo District Court said it approved a request from prosecutors to keep Ghosn until Dec. 10 for a further investigation of his suspected financial irregularities. Ghosn, 64, was arrested Nov. 19 by Tokyo prosecutors on suspicion he falsified financial statements and underreported his income and benefits. His first 10 days in custody expires at the end of Friday. The court said it also approved a 10-day detention extension for another former Nissan executive, Greg...

item.title: The man on a mission to get New Zealand's Māori out of prison - The Guardian
item.description:
The man on a mission to get New Zealand's Māori out of prison  The Guardian

Kelvin Davis describes himself as a member of “the most incarcerated tribe in the world”. The former teacher grew up in New Zealand’s deprived Northland region and has seen childhood friends, schoolmates and relatives locked away. Appointed the country’s corrections minister in 2017, he is now on a mission to empty the nation’s prisons of Māori inmates. And after just eight months with Davis in the job, the overall prison population has dropped by 8%. New Zealand has one of the highest incarceration rates in the OECD, and in March the country’s prison population hit a record 10,820 people –...

item.title: Japanese prosecutors vow to hold Ghosn as long as needed - The Associated Press
item.description:
Japanese prosecutors vow to hold Ghosn as long as needed  The Associated Press

TOKYO (AP) — Japanese prosecutors said Thursday they will detain former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn for as long as is needed to finish their investigation into suspicions of financial irregularities, as the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi alliance reaffirmed its partnership. Shin Kukimoto, deputy chief prosecutor for the Tokyo District Public Prosecutors' Office, defended its handling of Ghosn, who was arrested on Nov. 19 along with another Nissan executive, Greg Kelly. "We are not detaining (Ghosn) for an unnecessarily long time," Kukimoto told reporters. "We only take necessary steps as needed...

item.title: Austria arrests suspected spy after court ruling - Reuters
item.description:
Austria arrests suspected spy after court ruling  Reuters

An Austrian army colonel suspected of spying for Russia for 26 years was arrested on Friday after a court reversed a decision that there was no need to detain him pending trial. The case is embarrassing for Austria, which has some of the closest relations with Russia in the European Union. Moscow denies any involvement in the case, which was made public this month and was uncovered after a tip-off from Britain. "He has already been arrested," the prosecutors' office in Salzburg, where the recently retired colonel lives, said in a statement. A court in Salzburg initially dismissed the prosec...

item.title: Suspects remanded for another three days - The Star Online
item.description:
Suspects remanded for another three days  The Star Online

SUBANG JAYA: A lawyer and his colleague who were arrested in connection with the Seafield Sri Maha Mariamman Temple controversy have been remanded for another three days. Selangor police chief Comm Datuk Mazlan Mansor said this was to help with further investigations. He said he was aware of the allegations that RM150,000 was paid to the leader of the group that trespassed the temple. “We are investigating the matter. We have arrested 30 people in connection with the case,” he told reporters at the Subang Jaya police headquarters yesterday. He said nine new arrests were made in Selangor yes...

item.title: Nine more arrested for temple case, lawyer detained further, police seek info - The Star Online
item.description:
Nine more arrested for temple case, lawyer detained further, police seek info  The Star Online

SUBANG JAYA: A lawyer and his accomplice involved in the Seafield Sri Maha Mariamman Temple here have been remanded another three days. "In total we have arrested 30 people in connection with the case," he told reporters at the Subang Jaya police headquarters on Wednesday (Nov 28). He added that the nine new arrests were made around Selangor on Wednesday afternoon. A riot occurred around the temple on Monday after a group of thugs entered the compound to threaten the devotees. Several caretakers then contacted their friends and about 200 Indian men rushed there and cordoned off the temple. ...

item.title: Datuk among several immigration officers remanded over alleged corruption - The Star Online
item.description:
Datuk among several immigration officers remanded over alleged corruption  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Several senior immigration officers, including a woman and a Datuk, were remanded for alleged corruption. It is learnt that at least five people, including four immigration staff members, were remanded for four days by a magistrate's court here over the issuance of temporary work permits and passes. All are in their 30s and 40s. One of those arrested is a businessman. It is learnt that Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) officers arrested the five in a series of raids since Sunday (Nov 25). They also seized cash and the suspects' bank accounts have been frozen. MACC inve...

item.title: Austere Japan detention quarters contrast with Ghosn's globe-trotting lifestyle - Reuters
item.description:
Austere Japan detention quarters contrast with Ghosn's globe-trotting lifestyle  Reuters

Japanese prosecutors have confirmed that Nissan's arrested chairman, Carlos Ghosn, is being held in the spartan Tokyo Detention Center, its many rules and restrictions making for a stark contrast with his comfortable, globe-trotting lifestyle. Ghosn is most probably being held in a small 4.8-sq-m (52-sq-ft) room with a toilet at one end, say experts familiar with the facility. Many of its rooms have traditional straw tatami mats and a futon to sleep in. Others are Western-style with beds, said a Reuters reporter who has visited there. Detainees are allowed to shower on set days, although no...

item.title: Jeremy Brabrooke: Murderer on run from open prison spotted in church - The Independent
item.description:
Jeremy Brabrooke: Murderer on run from open prison spotted in church  The Independent

A convicted murderer who has been on the run from an open prison for more than five days has been spotted at a church in Hampshire. Jeremy Brabrooke has been on the run since he absconded from Ford Prison in West Sussex last Wednesday. Sussex Police have now released security camera footage of the last time he was sighted later that day on a visit St Faith’s Church in Havant, Hampshire. Read more - Murderer on run from prison in Northern Ireland - Prisoner hung himself after two days in jail - Prisoner back in custody after being accidentally released from jail The 56-year-old was sentenced...

item.title: Remand extended for 15 suspects in man's death during school carnival - The Star Online
item.description:
Remand extended for 15 suspects in man's death during school carnival  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU (Bernama): The remand order on 15 suspects in the murder of a man during a brawl at a school carnival in Skudai recently has been extended for seven days from Monday (Nov 19). Johor Criminal Investigation Department head SAC Kamaluddin Kassim said the police had initially obtained an order to remand them for a week and the order expired on Sunday (Nov 18). He said police would submit the investigation papers on the case to the state prosecution for the next course of action. Police have classified the investigations under Section 302 of the Penal Code for murder, Section 148 for ...

item.title: Temple riots: 16 remanded, including three One City employees - The Star Online
item.description:
Temple riots: 16 remanded, including three One City employees  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA (Bernama): The magistrate’s court here has issued a remand order for between two and five days against 16 individuals, including three employees of One City Development Sdn Bhd (One City), to help in investigations into the commotion at the Sri Maha Mariamman Temple in USJ25 in Subang Jaya on Monday (Nov 26). Magistrate Nor Ariffin Hisham on Tuesday (Nov 27) issued the order against the suspects, aged between 18 and 49, to facilitate police investigations under Section 435 of the Penal Code for mischief by fire, Section 148 of the same law for rioting, Section 427 of the same ...

item.title: Fifa ethics judge arrested in Malaysia on suspicion of corruption - The Guardian
item.description:
Fifa ethics judge arrested in Malaysia on suspicion of corruption  The Guardian

A Fifa ethics committee judge was arrested in Malaysia on suspicion of corruption and resigned on Wednesday as director of an arbitration service. Sundra Rajoo’s lawyer told the Associated Press his client had been detained by the Malaysian anti-corruption commission after returning from Fifa business in Zurich the previous evening. The lawyer, Cheow Wee, said a court refused a request for a seven-day remand order against Rajoo, and that he was later released unconditionally. “The judge agreed with our position that he [Rajoo] has diplomatic immunity and privileges,” Cheow said. “He cannot ...

item.title: Driver in fatal hit-and-run remanded - The Star Online
item.description:
Driver in fatal hit-and-run remanded  The Star Online

SERDANG: The driver of a vehicle which was allegedly involved in Sunday night’s hit-and-run accident that killed a customer at a hawker centre has been remanded for four days, police said. Serdang OCPD Asst Comm Ismadi Borhan said the driver, a man in his 20s, surrendered to police at 1.43am yesterday. “We obtained a remand order for him until Thursday. “His urine tested negative for drugs, but we have taken his blood sample to gauge his alcohol level,” he said, adding that the suspect has no criminal record. He said the suspect admitted to driving the four-wheel drive vehicle when the inci...

item.title: Prisoner who killed himself 'told staff voices were telling him to do so' - The Guardian
item.description:
Prisoner who killed himself 'told staff voices were telling him to do so'  The Guardian

A mentally ill prisoner who killed himself after spending two days in jail had told staff he was finding it hard to ignore the “voices” telling him to do so, a report has found. Michael Berry, 27, was deemed to be “high risk” when he was remanded at HMP Bedford in March 2017, appearing “distressed, hopeless, teary and prone to acting impulsively”, the report notes. Berry was in a “fragile” state and detoxifying from heroin and crack cocaine use. The report, by the prisons and probation ombudsman, says an officer who completed Berry’s initial reception screening told the investigator he did ...

item.title: Bourke St killer was on bail for driving offences - ABC News
item.description:
Bourke St killer was on bail for driving offences  ABC News

By Nino Bucci, ABC Investigations Bourke Street attacker Hassan Ali had his bail extended only weeks before the deadly rampage, despite a long history of failing to appear in court. Hassan Ali, 30, was charged on three separate occasions with minor driving offences dating back to February last year, and failed to attend court to answer any of them, law enforcement sources confirmed. His bail was forfeited for the first time in August last year, and then again six months later, before he was served with a warrant in October that extended his bail for another three months, according to court ...

item.title: In Prison for 16 Years, and Still Waiting for a Verdict - The New York Times
item.description:
In Prison for 16 Years, and Still Waiting for a Verdict  The New York Times

MEXICO CITY — Time seems to have stopped inside cell number six of Barrientos state prison, where Daniel García has been held for more than 16 years without a verdict. His distorted perception of time became clear more than a decade ago, when he sent his two daughters a dollhouse as a gift, seemingly unaware that they had grown into adults since 2002, when he was accused of murder and locked up. Mr. García is caught in the legal trappings of Mexico’s old judicial system, which allowed those accused of crimes ranging from murder to minor offenses to be held indefinitely as their cases dragge...

item.title: DoJ has until Dec to extradite Ng, says Amar Singh - The Star Online
item.description:
DoJ has until Dec to extradite Ng, says Amar Singh  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The United States Department of Justice (DoJ) has until the end of December to complete the extradition of former Goldman Sachs banker Roger Ng, says Bukit Aman. Commercial Crime Investigation Department (CCID) director Comm Datuk Seri Amar Singh Ishar Singh said DoJ has 60 days from the day Ng was arrested to complete the extradition. Ng was picked up on Nov 1 in connection with the 1Malaysia Develop­ment Bhd (1MDB) investigation and the police subsequently obtained a 60-day remand order pending the extradition. “We are assisting the DoJ in their indictment against Ng in conn...

item.title: Ex-Goldman banker Ng to be extradited to US within 60 days after Nov 1 arrest - The Star Online
item.description:
Ex-Goldman banker Ng to be extradited to US within 60 days after Nov 1 arrest  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Former Goldman Sachs banker Roger Ng is expected to be extradited to the United States within 60 days from the day of his arrest, in connection with the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) investigation, says Datuk Seri Amar Singh. The Bukit Aman Commercial Crime Investigation Department (CCID) director said Malaysian police obtained a 60-day remand order following Ng's arrest on Nov 1 in Malaysia. "We are assisting the US Department of Justice (DoJ). "The DoJ have to complete all the necessary arrangements and documentations in relation to the extradition process within the 60 d...

item.title: Home Ministry: Police to enhance SOP for dealing with mentally-challenged suspects - The Star Online
item.description:
Home Ministry: Police to enhance SOP for dealing with mentally-challenged suspects  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Police will enhance their standard operating procedure (SOP) when it comes to arresting and detaining suspects with special needs, including those with autism, says Deputy Home Minister Datuk Mohd Azis Jamman (pic). He said that currently, the Inspector General of Police's Standing Order D204 outlines procedures on arrests, detention and bail, among others. "However the Standing Order does not specify when it comes to dealing with suspects with special needs or autistic suspects. "Therefore, enhancements to the SOP will be done soon. This includes a study on how to conduct arr...

item.title: Russian accused of online fraud and wanted by the United States arrested in Bulgaria - CNN
item.description:
Russian accused of online fraud and wanted by the United States arrested in Bulgaria  CNN

A Russian citizen accused of online fraud involving millions of dollars has been arrested in Varna, Bulgaria, on a warrant issued by the United States and is awaiting extradition proceedings, according to a statement by the Varna District Court issued Thursday. A US Justice Department spokeswoman declined to comment on the arrest. "As a matter of longstanding policy, the US Department of Justice generally does not comment on extradition-related matters until a defendant is in the United States. There is nothing public at this time," US Justice Department spokeswoman Nicole Navas Oxman told ...

item.title: Court orders Armed Forces to reconvene inquiry into sailor’s death - The Star Online
item.description:
Court orders Armed Forces to reconvene inquiry into sailor’s death  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The High Court here has ordered the Malaysian Armed Forces Council to reconvene its inquiry to investigate whether a late navy personnel was physically and mentally abused while he was on duty. High Court (Appellate and Special Powers) judge Justice Nordin Hassan made the order after granting an application by the wife and parents of the late Laskar Kelas 1 (Able Rate) Muhammad Lailaltuiman Mohd Sukri to compel the council to reconvene its inquiry. Lailaltuiman's wife Nur Liya Asmira Yahya, 25; his parents Che Yah Che Cob and Mohd Sukri Salleh, both 53, had asked for the counc...

item.title: Suspect confesses to bathing baby on day of sexual abuse incident, say cops - The Star Online
item.description:
Suspect confesses to bathing baby on day of sexual abuse incident, say cops  The Star Online

KAJANG (Bernama): Kajang police chief ACP Ahmad Dzaffir Mohd Yussof said the suspect in the case of 11-month-old baby girl Nur Muazara Ulfa Mohammad Zainal who died due to sexual abuse has confessed to bathing the victim on the morning of the incident. He said the disclosure was made by the suspect, who was also the husband of the babysitter, to the police on Monday (Nov 12). “Before this, the suspect did not admit to handling the baby, but today's development has revealed he has been bathing and dressing the infant... so far, the suspect did not indicate he had done anything bad to the vic...

item.title: Austrian court orders release of suspected Russian spy pending trial - The Star Online
item.description:
Austrian court orders release of suspected Russian spy pending trial  The Star Online

VIENNA (Reuters) - A court on Tuesday rejected prosecutors' request that an Austrian army colonel suspected of spying for Russia for 26 years be remanded in custody pending trial. "There is no flight risk," the court in Salzburg handling the prosecutors' request said in a statement. Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz announced on Friday that the suspected espionage case had been uncovered and handed over to prosecutors. It follows other suspected Russian espionage cases in Europe that have heightened tensions with the West. The case is embarrassing for Austria, one of the few European Union...

item.title: Bogus MACC officers remanded for soliciting RM2mil bribe - The Star Online
item.description:
Bogus MACC officers remanded for soliciting RM2mil bribe  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA (Bernama): Four men who impersonated as Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) officers have been remanded for six days for allegedly soliciting RM2mil bribe from an individual with the honorific title of "Datuk Seri". Magistrate Muhammad Bukhori Md Ruslan issued the remand order against four men, aged 33 to 49, from Saturday (Nov 10) until Nov 15. Earlier, the four suspects, in MACC orange lock-up uniforms, were seen arriving at the Putrajaya court compound at 9.10am. Yesterday, the MACC arrested three individuals at a golf club in Sungai Buloh, Selangor, at 3pm while anothe...

item.title: 'McMafia' case: woman who spent £16m at Harrods granted bail - The Guardian
item.description:
'McMafia' case: woman who spent £16m at Harrods granted bail  The Guardian

A woman who spent £16m in Harrods and is subject to the UK’s first McMafia-style “dirty money” investigation has been released on bail after nine days in custody following a request for her extradition to Azerbaijan. Zamira Hajiyeva was arrested by the Metropolitan police last week at the request of authorities in Azerbaijan, where she is wanted on two charges of embezzlement. Her husband, Jahangir Hajiyev, was jailed in 2016 for defrauding Azerbaijan’s national bank out of up to 5bn manat (£2.2bn). Hajiyeva was released on bail on Thursday after a high court judge dismissed a request by th...

item.title: Canberra woman staged crime scene before making false rape claim to police - ABC News
item.description:
Canberra woman staged crime scene before making false rape claim to police  ABC News

By Elizabeth Byrne A Canberra woman who accused her former partner of rape nearly five years ago has admitted she made up the claim, which saw him spend months behind bars. As a five-day hearing into the matter began in the ACT Magistrates Court, Sarah-Jane Parkinson, 28, unexpectedly pleaded guilty to making the false claim in March 2014 and even staging a crime scene. Parkinson, a former police worker, also pleaded guilty to possessing a prohibited weapon after she was found with capsicum spray. The original allegations were made against Parkinson's former partner while he was a prison of...

item.title: Australia police say Melbourne attacker was known to authorities - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Australia police say Melbourne attacker was known to authorities  Al Jazeera English

Australian police said on Saturday a man who fatally stabbed a person and injured two others in central Melbourne "held radicalised views" that prompted him to carry out the attack. The perpetrator, Hassain Khalif Shire Ali, 30, had his passport canceled in 2015 after it was learned he planned to travel to Syria, police said. The attack occurred on Friday when Shire Ali got out of a pickup vehicle, which he then set on fire, and stabbed three men, one of whom died at the scene. The attack on Bourke Street horrified hundreds of onlookers during the afternoon rush hour in Australia's second-b...

item.title: Almost RM200K of ketamine seized, cops say drug crimes up this year - The Star Online
item.description:
Almost RM200K of ketamine seized, cops say drug crimes up this year  The Star Online

SHAH ALAM: Almost RM200,000 worth of ketamine, hidden in a secret compartment of a car, were seized at a parking lot of a condominium in Kajang. A 40-year-old man, believed to be trafficking the drugs, was arrested during the operation on Nov 2. Selangor Narcotics Crime Investigation Department (NCID) deputy chief Supt R. Sundralingam said the drugs were hidden in a secret compartment, which required one to push a button, located on the right side of the driver's seat. "The compartment was located behind the rear passenger's seat. "We believe this is one of the ways drug syndicates are usin...

item.title: Ex-Immigration director in RM1mil bribery case released on MACC bail - The Star Online
item.description:
Ex-Immigration director in RM1mil bribery case released on MACC bail  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: The former director of the Immigration Department who was detained over a million ringgit bribery case has been released from remand. Magistrate Khir Nizam Jemari allowed the 47-year-old, together with a 46-year-old driver of the department, to be released on Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) bail. The two were arrested on Oct 31 and were remanded for seven days to allow MACC's investigations into the case. Meanwhile, a 56-year-old clerk who was also arrested with the two will have his seven day remand extended by another two days. The three are being investigated over ...

item.title: 7 girls escape probation hostel in Jitra, four later caught - The Star Online
item.description:
7 girls escape probation hostel in Jitra, four later caught  The Star Online

JITRA: Seven girls undergoing a moral rehabilitation at Asmara Akhlak (Perempuan) Jitra in Kubang Pasu escaped from the probation hostel during the wee hours of Deepavali on Tuesday (Nov 6). The incident occurred at about 1am at the probation hostel located at KM23.7 of Bukit Kayu Hitam Expressway. The welfare assistant on duty was alerted by other inmates about the seven girls, after they went missing. Kubang District Police Chief Superintendent Police (SUPT) Mohd Ismail Ibrahim said the hostel later conducted a search of surrounding areas and found out the seven inmates had escaped throug...

item.title: Nigerian Shi'ite leader denied bail after supporters killed during protest - The Star Online
item.description:
Nigerian Shi'ite leader denied bail after supporters killed during protest  The Star Online

KADUNA, Nigeria (Reuters) - The leader of Nigeria's minority Shi'ite Muslims was denied bail on Wednesday, days after the group said more than 40 of its members were killed by security forces shooting at protesters calling for his release. Ibrahim Zakzaky, leader of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN), has been held in detention since December 2015 when the army killed hundreds of his followers at his compound and a nearby mosque and burial ground in northern Kaduna state. He is facing trial for murder, culpable homicide, unlawful assembly, disruption of public peace and other charges fol...

item.title: Spain prosecutor seeks long jail terms for Catalan pro-independence leaders - Reuters
item.description:
Spain prosecutor seeks long jail terms for Catalan pro-independence leaders  Reuters

Spain's public prosecutor on Friday sought jail terms of up to 25 years for nine leaders of Catalonia's independence movement, filing charges of rebellion and misuse of public funds over a failed secession bid that they spearheaded last year. But the State Attorney - a separate government-appointed body also prosecuting in the case - said rebellion charges should be dropped in favor of the lesser offence of sedition and that it would seek maximum sentences of 12 years. Madrid imposed direct rule on the wealthy northeastern region in October 2017 after it declared its independence on the bas...

item.title: Government failing in duty of care to prisoners as jail sentences lead to poorer health, MPs warn - The Independent
item.description:
Government failing in duty of care to prisoners as jail sentences lead to poorer health, MPs warn  The Independent

The government is failing in its duty of care towards prisoners, as going to jail has become not only a deprivation of liberty but a “sentence to poorer health or healthcare”, MPs have warned. A new report by a parliamentary committee found increasingly “unsafe and unsanitary” prison conditions following budget reductions and a loss of prison officers were limiting prisoners’ access to healthcare and their ability to lead healthy lives. The Health and Social Care Select Committee warned record levels of violence and self-harm, a poor quality diet and limited time out of cells due to staff s...

item.title: Peru opposition leader Fujimori ordered back to jail by judge - The Star Online
item.description:
Peru opposition leader Fujimori ordered back to jail by judge  The Star Online

LIMA (Reuters) - A judge on Wednesday ordered Peru's opposition leader, Keiko Fujimori, returned to jail pending a trial over allegations she used her conservative party to launder money for Brazilian construction company Odebrecht [ODBES.UL]. The daughter of a former president, Alberto Fujimori, and a twice-defeated presidential candidate, Keiko Fujimori has repeatedly denied wrongdoing and described the prosecution's efforts to imprison her as "political persecution." Fujimori, 43, spent a week in police custody earlier this month before being released on appeal. But Judge Richard Concepc...

item.title: Pipe bomb suspect Cesar Sayoc planned 'terrorist attack' since July, DOJ says - CNN
item.description:
Pipe bomb suspect Cesar Sayoc planned 'terrorist attack' since July, DOJ says  CNN

A man accused of sending pipe bombs to prominent Democrats had been planning to send the explosive devices for months, the Department of Justice says. In a letter sent Tuesday, Geoffrey S. Berman, the US Attorney for the Southern District of New York, said the FBI searched suspect Cesar Sayoc's laptop and found documents containing the victims' addresses and return labels similar to those used on the intercepted packages. "Metadata from the electronic devices indicates that the defendant started planning the attack as early as July 2018," Berman wrote in a letter to Magistrate Judge Edwin G...

item.title: Policeman did not check on suspected rapist after hearing snoring and verbal responses from cell, Hong Kong court told - The Star Online
item.description:
Policeman did not check on suspected rapist after hearing snoring and verbal responses from cell, Hong Kong court told  The Star Online

A policeman did not check on a Hong Kong rape suspect who later hanged himself in custody, telling an inquest on Friday he had heard snoring and verbal responses coming from the man’s direction. The third day of the inquest into the death of Lam Wing-chun revealed that the officer, Tai Wai-hou, skipped at least five patrols to Lam’s cell just hours before he died at the Sau Mau Ping police station on the morning of May 11, 2017. Tai’s senior sergeant, Yeung Kai-kwong, had missed three of his own patrols, the Coroner’s Court heard. While there were records entered in the log book, surveillan...

item.title: Defense: Protester intended radioactive substance for self - The Associated Press
item.description:
Defense: Protester intended radioactive substance for self  The Associated Press

MADISON, Wis. (AP) — An attorney for a Wisconsin political activist accused of trying to buy a lethal dose of a radioactive substance online said Monday his client intended to use it to kill himself because he has cancer. Federal public defender Joseph Bugni argued that a criminal complaint filed last week against Jeremy Ryan, 30, of the Town of Madison, does not state specifically what material was being sought, so prosecutors had failed to show probable cause. But U.S. Magistrate Judge Stephen Crocker found probable cause that Ryan had committed a federal offense and ordered him to remain...

item.title: Cyberjaya hit-and-run suspects freed following High Court order - The Star Online
item.description:
Cyberjaya hit-and-run suspects freed following High Court order  The Star Online

SHAH ALAM (Bernama): The three suspects in the hit and run case of a woman in Cyberjaya last week have been released following a High Court order. High Court judge Justice Ab Karim Ab Rahman ordered the release of the three men - a Yemeni and two Libyans - after one of them sought a revision of the magistrate’s court order. The men were arrested after a car recklessly hit Wan Amirah Wan Alias, 31, an assistant manager with Unifi. She died at Hospital Putra­jaya at 5am last Thursday. The High Court found that the lower court had erred when it did not free the men from a previous remand deten...

item.title: Young black Portuguese men take police brutality case to court - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Young black Portuguese men take police brutality case to court  Al Jazeera English

Eighteen months ago, they were defendants, accused of storming a police station. But since that case was overturned last year, Flavio Almada, Celso Lopes, Rui Moniz, Miguel Reis, Paulo Veiga and Bruno Lopes have been testifying not as the accused, but as victims in an unprecedented trial that has put 17 officers of the PSP - Portugal's public police force - in the dock. The new case, currently being heard in court, rejects the version of events previously offered by the police officers, and charges them with physical assault, aggravated kidnapping, inhumane treatment and inciting racially-m...

item.title: British woman who allegedly killed husband to be charged with murder on Tuesday (Oct 30) - The Star Online
item.description:
British woman who allegedly killed husband to be charged with murder on Tuesday (Oct 30)  The Star Online

LANGKAWI: The 51-year old British woman who allegedly stabbed her husband to death at their home in Langkawi will face a murder charge at the magistrate's court here on Tuesday (Oct 30) morning. “She will be charged under Section 302 of the Penal Code for murder at the Langkawi magistrate's court on Tuesday (Oct 30) at 8.30am,” Langkawi OCPD Superintendent Mohd Iqbal Ibrahim told The Star on Monday (Oct 29). The woman, a housewife, had earlier been remanded for six days fromOct 18 till Oct 23. Subsequently, her remand order was extended for another week to Oct 30 to further assist police in...

item.title: Man arrested for trying to steal Magna Carta - The Guardian
item.description:
Man arrested for trying to steal Magna Carta  The Guardian

A man has been arrested on suspicion of trying to steal a Magna Carta from Salisbury Cathedral. Wiltshire police said the 45-year-old was arrested on Thursday after alarms were triggered by an attempt to smash the glass box in which the artefact was displayed. A man matching witnesses’ descriptions was arrested on suspicion of attempted theft, possession of an offensive weapon and criminal damage. Police said he remained in custody. The document was not damaged in the incident. Magna Carta, one of the most significant documents in British history, is a peace treaty that was sealed by King J...

item.title: Madagascar pre-trial detainees face 'life-threatening conditions' - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Madagascar pre-trial detainees face 'life-threatening conditions'  Al Jazeera English

At least 52 people died in Madagascar's prisons last year while awaiting trial due to "appalling prison conditions", according to Amnesty International. In a report published on Tuesday, the global rights group also said that thousands of people who have not been found guilty of any crime were subject to "life-threatening prison conditions", including severe overcrowding and poor hygiene as well as lack of food and medical care. The main causes of death was respiratory problems and cardiovascular diseases, Amnesty said, citing prison authorities. The report was based on visits to nine pris...

item.title: Former spy chief's suit against MACC dismissed - The Star Online
item.description:
Former spy chief's suit against MACC dismissed  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The High Court here has dismissed a lawsuit filed by ex-spy boss Datuk Hasanah Abdul Hamid (pic) against the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) for allegedly disallowing her to consult her lawyer while she was in remand. In his decision, High Court judge Justice Nordin Hassan said Sections 28A(8) and (9) of the Criminal Procedure Code, which touched on the rights of an arrested person, did not infringe Article 5(3) and Article 8 of the Federal Constitution. "Both sections do not deny the right to counsel but it is rather the suspension of those rights during remand pe...

item.title: Two men in Cyberjaya incident rearrested for drugs, rioting - The Star Online
item.description:
Two men in Cyberjaya incident rearrested for drugs, rioting  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Two of the three men who were released by the High Court in connection with the hit-and-run case of a woman in Cyberjaya have been rearrested, this time for drugs and rioting. Sepang OCPD Asst Comm Abdul Aziz Ali said that police would seek to remand them. “They have been released in the murder case but they have several outstanding cases against them including drugs and rioting,” he said yesterday. He did not specify which two of the three men were rearrested. It is also unclear if any of them was under the influence of drugs during the hit-and-run. On Oct 17, an assistant m...
